MS MCQs

    Trace serial and lot numbers in Dynamics 365 Business Central

    »

    1. What is the difference between the Trace function and the Navigate function?

      The Navigate function only shows the ledger entries on which serial numbers and lot numbers are used, and the Trace function only shows the documents on which serial and lot numbers are used.

      The Trace function only shows the posted transactions on which serial and lot numbers are used. The Navigate function also shows the non-posted transactions, like sales order lines, to which serial and lot numbers are assigned.

      From the Navigate function, you can only open the documents on which serial and lot numbers are used. This action is not possible on the Trace function.

      You can use the Trace function only for item tracking codes that are set up for specific tracking. The Navigate function is available for all item tracking codes.


    2. You want to trace a serial number from origin to usage. What is the best way to accomplish this task?

      With the Trace function, you can trace serial numbers and lot number from origin to usage or from usage to origin.

      With the Navigate function, you can trace serial numbers and lot number from origin to usage or from usage to origin.

      You can filter the item ledger entries by serial or lot number and then sort them in ascending order.

      You can filter the value entries by serial or lot number and then sort them in ascending order.
